title: Eksistentiaalilause - Existential Sentences
description: Practice Finnish existential sentences ‚Äì expressing what exists where
instructions: Identify, form, and understand Finnish existential sentences

structure.description: Existential sentences describe something existing in a place.
structure.formula: PLACE (ssa/lla) + ON/EI OLE + OBJECT (partitive or nominative)
steps: Start with the PLACE in inessive (-ssa/-ss√§) or adessive (-lla/-ll√§) case
Use ON (positive) or EI OLE (negative) ‚Äì always in 3rd person singular
The OBJECT that exists: nominative for one item, partitive for quantities/negatives

examples.english: There is a sauna in the house.
There is milk in the fridge.
There is no table in the room.
There is a rug on the floor.

object_form.nominative: Used for a single, definite countable object: P√∂yd√§ll√§ on kirja. (There is a book on the table.)
object_form.partitive: Used for: mass nouns (maitoa, vett√§), negatives (ei ole p√∂yt√§√§), or quantities (kaksi kirjaa)

question_sets.title: Valitse eksistentiaalilause
question_sets.instructions_en: Choose which sentence is an existential sentence.

pairs.explanation: "Talossa on sauna" is existential ‚Äì it means 'There is a sauna in the house.' PLACE (talossa) + ON + OBJECT (sauna). 'Turku on kaunis' is a descriptive sentence (Turku is beautiful).
"Helsingiss√§ on metro" is existential ‚Äì 'There is a metro in Helsinki.' PLACE (Helsingiss√§) + ON + OBJECT (metro). 'M√§ juon kahvia' is a regular subject-verb-object sentence.
"Lattialla on matto" is existential ‚Äì 'There is a rug on the floor.' PLACE (lattialla) + ON + OBJECT (matto). 'Lisa on kotoisin Saksasta' describes where Lisa is from.
"Huoneessa ei ole p√∂yt√§√§" is existential ‚Äì 'There is no table in the room.' Negative existential: PLACE + EI OLE + OBJECT (partitive). 'M√§ asun Turussa' uses a regular verb (asua = to live).

"J√§√§kaapissa on maitoa ja juustoa" is existential ‚Äì 'There is milk and cheese in the fridge.' PLACE (j√§√§kaapissa) + ON + OBJECTS (maitoa, juustoa ‚Äì partitive). 'Mulla on koira' is a possession sentence.
"Pihalla on auto" is existential ‚Äì 'There is a car in the yard.' PLACE (pihalla) + ON + OBJECT (auto). 'Auto on punainen' is descriptive (The car is red).
"Kirjastossa on paljon kirjoja" is existential ‚Äì 'There are many books in the library.' PLACE + ON + OBJECT (partitive, quantity). 'H√§n lukee kirjaa' is a regular action sentence.
"Saunassa on kiuas" is existential ‚Äì 'There is a sauna stove in the sauna.' PLACE + ON + OBJECT (kiuas). 'Saunassa on kuuma' describes a quality (it's hot in the sauna).
